briefTitle: A New Drug for Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) Compared With Placebo

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Males in good general health and at least 50 years of age, with symptoms of moderate to severe BPH.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Medical conditions that would confound the efficacy evaluation.
* Medical conditions in which it would be unsafe to use an alpha-blocker.
* The use of concomitant drugs that would confound the efficacy evaluation.
* The use of concomitant drugs that would be unsafe with this alpha-blocker.

outcomeMeasures.title: Measuring Change From Baseline in International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) at 12 Weeks
outcomeMeasures.description: International prostate symptom score: Measuring prostate signs and symptoms asociated with benign prostatic hyperplasia on a 0 to 35 scale; 0 best, 35 worst symptoms
